etymology.description: Depicts an arrow stuck into the ground -> express arrival or reaching a destination
etymology.interpretation: The image of an arrow embedded in the ground symbolizes reaching a fixed endpoint, evoking the idea of arriving at a particular place.

examples.chinese: 从广州出发(從廣州出發)，火车已至目的地(火車已至目的地)。
examples.pinyin: Cóng Guǎngzhōu chūfā, huǒchē yǐ zhì mùdìdì.
examples.english: Departing from Guangzhou, the train has arrived at its destination.

examples.chinese: 信使至长安(信使至長安)。
examples.english: The messenger has arrived in Chang'an.
